intro: Tetraneuris septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Tetraneuris septentrionalis is a herbaceous perennial that is adapted to withstand drought and harsh environmental conditions.
